Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This year I decided to really get into the spirit of Halloween.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [screaming upon seeing pumpkin-headed Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [screaming then laughing] It may have been the costliest decision I've ever made.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My greased up head went into the pumpkin no problem, but ...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It won't budge.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't get it out. Try again!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I mean, I could try destroying the pumpkin...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [as Jim approaches with a knife] Jim, no. No. No! No!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But as Jim and I discovered... No! ... any blow to the pumpkin itself could prove fatal to me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: At first I drove myself crazy thinking about the things I should have done differently. I never should have played that joke on Erin. I never should have hollowed out this damn pumpkin in the first place. Then I realized that I was being silly. I mean the pumpkin should rot off of my head in a month or two. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey guys.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Pam, what are you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I am Dr. Cinderella.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cece's really into princesses now. So we decided to turn them into a positive female role models.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm an oncologist and you are a dog.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, I'm a puppy. Dang it! I was worried that would happen.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Uh, Jim, you're not dressed up at all.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure I am. I am... one of the Men in Black guys. [to Pam, under his breath] Can I have your sunglasses?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Jim, come on. I thought we were past this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So the sports marketing business that Jim told everyone about except for me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There's a big investment lunch today, so I decided to skip the costume.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Unless he has a secret costume that he told everyone about except for me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Gettin' a lot of mileage out of this, aren't ya?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, get used to it, bud.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A jitterbug. [giggles] You guys look great! Just a reminder. The party is right after lunch, so make sure you get all your work done before that or throw it out. Any questions?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The senator will be joining us later.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not a question.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, it wasn't.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Excellent. That reminds me, has anyone seen Treble? Anyone? I could have sworn I saw some Treble somewhere.

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [singing]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, ladies and gentlemen, Here Comes Treble!

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [sings Karma Chameleon]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Aaah! [everyone clapping] So good!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What lab did these little clones escape from?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My Cornell a capella group.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You were in an a capella group?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You went to Cornell?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yah! ah. Okay. Ha ha ha ha. But you have no idea how lucky you are because HCT is doing a set at our halloween party.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Ugh. I don't want to sit through a whole concert of that.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I do. I love the boss's interests.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Atta boy Clark!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Where you boys stayin? How does it work in the rooms? Do you get a privacy partition?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. Nope. Nope nope nope. Stay away.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know what I just realized? They might actually call me up to solo on George Michael's Faith. That was one of my signature songs. Oh, man. That would be insane. I'm so not prepared.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you sure you're okay with me putting in this much money.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. I mean, listen if we're gonna do this thing, we should do it right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're the best.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I kind of am. It's crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. I'll see you in a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim. Look I'm eating you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha ha. Hey Erin, look, these are Nerds. I'm eating Jims.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughing] Must eat more Jims. Oink oink oink oink.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [laughing hysterically] Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh no, I'm spilling Jim all over the carpet. [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Stop it stop it stop it stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [picking up spilled candy] Hello little pill. What do you do?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dumatril is licensed to treat anxiety symptoms, such as panic attacks, excessive worrying, and fear. Translation: There's a madman in our midst.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay I give up. What are you?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I'm sexy Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughing] Gross. I love it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dumatril!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Something wrong Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dumatril.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is a pill that I found here in the office. But it's not for worms or eczema like any normal pill. It's not for any disorder of the body. [whispering] It's for a disorder of the mind.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: The mind is part of the body.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, this is a pill that combats insanity, okay? Whoever is taking it is not only insane... [whispering] They are now off their meds.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Dwight, our co-workers' health issues are really none of our business so-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why are you trying so hard to bury this thing, huh? What's going on Nellie? Talk to me.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Hm?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: It's my pill. I have an anxiety issue and I'm not ashamed of that, But I'm not loving the idea of Dwight having that information. I once saw him yell at Phyllis for sneezing wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yeah, you're right. This man needs to be apprehended.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll get my apprehension kit.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ruh duh duh da dudes! What's up?

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [mumbled responses]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know that it's pathetic to re-live your college years, but cut me some slack, Okay? Because I was a freaking rock star in college. When I joined Here Comes Treble, that's when I became somebody. When I got the nickname "Boner Champ," that is when I became me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You didn't come here to sit in a room, right? You came here for some intergenerational bro time. Well, now's your chance! I'm here. You got Qs; I got As.

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #1
Quote.Text: Did you say you've got AIDS?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, I don't have AIDS. That's not what I said. Next question.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [awkward silence]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You don't have any- Any questions about the old days? [clears throat] You at least want to know why they call me Boner Champ?

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #2
Quote.Text: I thought Broccoli Rob was the Boner Champ.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, what?

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #2
Quote.Text: I just thought Broccoli Rob was the Boner Champ.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Broccoli Rob was Broccoli Rob. Andy Bernard is the Boner Champ.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I didn't realize that everybody here dresses up every year.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Me neither.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: It's Halloween. That is really, really good timing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was just talking to some of the actives, and they think that you're Boner Champ.

Quote.Speaker: Broccoli Rob
Quote.Text: [on computer monitor] I'm so sorry! I don't know how that could have happened.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did you maybe tell them that or...?

Quote.Speaker: Broccoli Rob
Quote.Text: I just- I just started yappin' about the old days, and I guess the wine coolers were flowing, and, you know, somehow things just got hinky.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Could you just call them and tell them the truth? 'Cause I know it's really stupid, but it's also really, really, really important.

Quote.Speaker: Broccoli Rob
Quote.Text: Will do. I love you, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Love you too.

Quote.Speaker: Businessman #1
Quote.Text: So the workspace looks awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Businessman #2
Quote.Text: And the graphic designer is going to be sending in some of the logo treatments. I can't wait to see them.

Quote.Speaker: Businessman #3
Quote.Text: You guys rock. [round of fistbumps]

Quote.Speaker: Businessman #1
Quote.Text: I killed it.

Quote.Speaker: Businessman #2
Quote.Text: I've also been running the numbers and between our backers and our own investments, we're looking great for a full year on this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, uh, is it too late to get in?

Quote.Speaker: Businessman #3
Quote.Text: Oh Jim, I explained everything. So you're all set.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I actually talked to my wife and we'd really like to uh you know, invest - get in on the ground floor.

Quote.Speaker: Businessman #2
Quote.Text: Wow, well what level of investment were you thinking about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We were thinking somewhere between five - ten thousand? I can do the full ten thousand. We should just - [blows air] - all in.

Quote.Speaker: Businessman #3
Quote.Text: Welcome aboard!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. [laughs] Awesome. Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hi Daryl. I'm just here to smear some peanut butter on my forehead.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You know, to uh, to protect his brain from the nanobots that the government put in the air conditioning.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That makes sense to you, right? Or does it sound... crazy?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I can't really picture it. Can you... get it on there. Yeah. And maybe, get the cheeks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So this makes sense then. Or is it crazy?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Get under your chin first. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is that where the nanobots like to come in?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Take it all the way up to your lip, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is that how they like to get in?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering] I don't know. I just don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yo! Bad boys of a capella.

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [mumbling] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Heard any good stories lately? Or new twists on old stories?

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #3
Quote.Text: Yeah, I got a call from Broccoli Rob. I guess you really are the Boner Champ.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did he tell you how I got the name?

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #3
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Spring sing '95. Got completely ripped on Bud Dries. I had sex with a snowman. I just went at that thing. Cold would have stopped most people but I stayed locked in, you know. Took the face off. It just seemed easier that way.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And I told Phyllis not to put it out, but she insisted. So, anyway... Hi! Oh, Oscar, remember my husband, the senator?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Senator Lipton, nice to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Senator Lipton
Quote.Text: Nice to see you Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Wait a second, who designed this spread? The sweets and savories are all mixed together. This is mayhem!

Quote.Speaker: Senator Lipton
Quote.Text: So Oscar, you're a dinosaur.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Actually I'm the electoral college.

Quote.Speaker: Senator Lipton
Quote.Text: Ouch! Right on target.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You know what? This is outrageous. I have to find Phyllis. You two talk, okay? Sorry babe.. Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Senator Lipton
Quote.Text: God, it's just so good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I, uh, huh, just [chuckles nervously]

Quote.Speaker: Senator Lipton
Quote.Text: All having this wonderful Halloween gathering. Excuse me, is that punch?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They didn't know about the snowman story, and when I told 'em, they were not impressed.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What is with these turkeys?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey! You better do 'Faith.' You get me?

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #3
Quote.Text: We don't know it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So learn it. You all go to Cornell, you're like eight Rain men. Just learning the friggin' song.

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #3
Quote.Text: Look, I know it was big with the old guys, but-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Buts... are for pooping. Okay? Make it work. You have to or Andy will flip out... And make it a surprise, please. [to Pete] This isn't stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Hey Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Are... are you me?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh my goodness, look. Look at this.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yeah. I...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [unintelligible mumbling]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes. I thought I'd you know, be you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Look at.. Look at me. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [laughing] It's funny right? [Toby starts to lean in for a kiss, then runs away]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right. All right, just ...stay focused on the pill.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Okay, look Dwight, let's just call this thing off. I mean, it's just an anxiety pill. Lots of people have anxiety.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You think I don't have anxiety? I have anxiety all the time. Every waking moment of my life is sheer torture. I have land disputes I've got to settle and idiot cousins to protect. And ne'er- do- well siblings to take care of. But I don't need some stupid pill to get me through all this.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Cool. Free upper.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah ha! Ha!!! The jig is up, psychopath! Ah yeah! Gotcha!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Don't dog catch me!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gotcha! Yeah! Let's see ya get out of this web, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Let me out!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: The pill is mine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Get her out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Stop baggin' my head!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh Dwight, look, its just a pill, all right? It's for anxiety. I take it every day. And it makes me feel better. And maybe it could help you too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, how'd it go?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh man, it was great. They were great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you end up investing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I did, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How much?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, man, by the end I guess it was about... ten...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: About ten?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ten. It was the full ten.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah. It's a good thing we talked about it though, because we had to...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No yeah. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So did everybody ...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did everybody end up investing ten thousand?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, oh man, I don't actually know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: They weren't really talking that much about money. They just said, We're good with investing and then I...and I...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen, Here Comes Treble!

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [vocalizing]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They said they were done with the investing and then you volunteered ten thousand dollars?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, I had to. Look, I needed to look like a team player, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So you invested ten thousand dollars to look like a team player?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You weren't there.

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [singing 'I'll Be']

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It was very clear that ten thousand was what we had...we should talk about it later.

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [singing 'I'll Be' directly to Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Talk about it now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim, that was most of our savings.

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [still singing]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Wait! Wait. Hold on. Where's the band? 'Cause there's just no way you guys are making this magic with just your mouths.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Yeah. That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: What, am I overdoing it? No. No.

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [singing]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We said some. We said 'some.'

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We'll talk about it later.

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [singing]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We said part not all.

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [singing 'Car Wash']

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yes! All right!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh Man! [clapping]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: That's how you do that! Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Show some pride. This is crap.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I agree. Yes, crap. Continue.

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #3
Quote.Text: Now folks, by special request, we're going to take it a little old school. There is a former Trebler in this room.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Who?

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #3
Quote.Text: It's Mr. Andy Bernard!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: [clapping]

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [singing 'Faith']

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. Do not sing that. Do not... Oh man...

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #3
Quote.Text: He reminded us today of how much he means to us. And we certainly seem to mean a lot to him, so without any further ado, here's an old Treble classic.

Quote.Speaker: HCT
Quote.Text: [singing 'Faith']

Quote.Speaker: Broccoli Rob
Quote.Text: [on flat screen tv] [singing lead of Faith]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa! Whoa! What the hell is Broccoli Rob doing here?

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #3
Quote.Text: She said you wanted to hear 'Faith'. That's Broccoli Rob's signature song.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's my signature song.

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #3
Quote.Text: I really didn't know that man. I just thought you wanted to hear it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Russell, I'm dressed like George Michael.

Quote.Speaker: HCT Member #3
Quote.Text: I thought you were Adam Lambert.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wha...?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: The more I hear about all this a capella drama, the more I think it's kind of pathetic. But when you're with someone, you put up with the stuff that makes you lose respect for them, and that is love.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Are you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Broccoli Rob
Quote.Text: [on screen] He's still mad.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Shut up, Broccoli.

Quote.Speaker: Broccoli Rob
Quote.Text: Champ, I feel awful about this whole thing. Russell called me up. And they said they needed 20 cc's of George Michael stat. So just... Wham! I sprang into action. You know me. I assumed you wanted to hear me do your signature number.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You thought I wanted to sit in the audience like some slutty Treb rat? A man's signature solo is his for life, okay? That's group policy and you know it.

Quote.Speaker: Broccoli Rob
Quote.Text: Look, it's not my fault that I still live near campus, and it's my duty as an alum to be friendly to the young guys., and stop in two, three times a week.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just don't do the song anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Broccoli Rob
Quote.Text: I tell you what, we'll have a sing-off for it. You pick twelve alums from any year to back you up and I'll do the same, and I'm so confident that I'll win, I won't even warm up.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fine, go ahead. Thrash your pipes.

Quote.Speaker: Broccoli Rob
Quote.Text: My pipes are primo, Champ. Why don't you ask Trey Anastasio about my pipes?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I knew you would go there, you son of a bitch!

Quote.Speaker: Broccoli Rob
Quote.Text: He said, and I quote, 'Hey Rob, nice pipes'. That happened!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK, fine, yeah. that's one guy's opinion!

Quote.Speaker: Broccoli Rob
Quote.Text: That's real. 'That'll never change!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Doesn't mean you're the best singer ever. Dick.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I thought that concert was pretty great.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh yeah. I decided that acapelca music is awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: They lost me when they sang 'Monster Mash'. That song obviously glorifies the occult.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Angela, it's Halloween. You have to sing 'Monster Mash'.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh you have to Jim? You literally have to?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No I'm just, I'm saying, what would happen if they didn't sing it? Would they go to jail? Would they be shot?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. We'll, just forget it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No! No, I'm interested. I mean I think everybody's interested in why they have to sing it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because it is Halloween. So if you're going to sing a concert, it's a good idea to throw that one in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, no, no. It's a good idea to brush your teeth. But you have to um, feed your children. Send them to school. You know, all things you can't do if you just keep singing 'Monster Mash.'

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It turns out, that Pam? Really, really hates 'Monster Mash.' I mean like, never bring that song up in front of her. Even though Jim was making great points, like, in favor of the song, Pam was like, No! Hate it! Stupid!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is all so silly right? What am I gonna do? Move back to Cornell?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [laughing] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I mean, what if we did that? Like we got jobs and we were happy all the time?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh well, Andy, we're not moving to Cornell.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Duh. I know. That would be insane.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It could totally work though. I don't know why we wouldn't. Oh my god are we doing this?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oy. Andy, what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If I am not Boner Champ, I don't know who I am.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, um, you know maybe you're the wise old guy that the new uh, B-O-N-E-R champ looks up to. You know, you could just-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Make a donation.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, I was gonna say, be a mentor.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes. I am gonna make a donation. And it just so happens that I know someone who works at the Bernard Family Foundation. Her name is mom.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering] I want some of those pills.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, well good for you. I mean, you'll need a prescription.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no. No, no, no. no. They're not for me. They're for my cousin Mose. He's just having a tough time, being wifeless, and a high pressure job and his crazy cousin Mose. Other cousin Mose.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Mm. Got it. Well, you tell Mose that he's a good man and that I hope he feels better.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Which one? Mose or the real Mose?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: The real Mose.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He says Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on phone] Mom, I had this really charitable idea to set up this scholarship for a capella kids at Cornell and just need to wire some money over there. [pause] What?

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [HTC singing Cornell Alma Mater]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What's wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My parents are broke.
